clinical_study.brief_title: Staged Extended Thoracoscopic Sympathicotomy for Palmo-axillo-plantar Hyperhidrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Staged Extended Thoracoscopic Sympathicotomy for Palmo-axillo-plantar Hyperhidrosis; a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of staged endoscopic thoracoscopic sympathicotomy in treatment of palmo-axillo-plantar hyperhidrosis

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a pilot study that investigates the efficacy of video-assisted endoscopic sympathicotomy from the level of T3 to T12 on combined palmar and plantar hyperhidrosis.
Ablation of ascending sympathetic fibers would help alleviating both types of hyperhidrosis in a single setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in severity of hyperhidrosis on visual analogue scale at 24 months
primary_outcome.description: decrease in the severity of hyperhidrosis, both palmar and plantar, according to visual analogue scale

arm_group.description: Video-assisted endoscopic sympathicotomy from level of T3 to level of T12 on one side

intervention.description: Thoracoscopic approach of sympathetic ganglia T3-T12 on one side, retraction of the diaphragm and lung laterally to expose the ganglia then ablation of each ganglion using electrocauterization.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with combined palmo-axillo-plantar hyperhidrosis of ASA grade I and II
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under 16 years.
- Patients with bradycardia (heart rate <80 beats per minute).
- Patients with concomitant lung pathology, frozen mediastinum, pleural effusion, or history of intercostal tube insertion.
- Patients with cardiac problems with ejection fraction less than 60%.
- Patient suffering from isolated palmo-axillary hyperhidrosis not associated with plantar hyperhidrosis.
- Patients suffering from craniofacial hyperhidrosis, either isolated or combined with other areas of hyperhidrosis.
